solution_line_template: She wants to send a dozen carnations that cost ${dozen_carnation_price}/dz to each of her {num_teachers} teachers, so {dozen_carnation_price}*{num_teachers} = $<<{dozen_carnation_price}*{num_teachers}={cost_for_teachers}>>{cost_for_teachers}

She has {num_friends} friends and she knows a dozen carnations is cheaper than buying {carnations_per_dozen} single carnations. So {num_friends}-{carnations_per_dozen} = <<{num_friends}-{carnations_per_dozen}={remaining_single_carnations}>>{remaining_single_carnations} single carnations are needed

All total she will spend {cost_for_teachers}+{dozen_carnation_price}+{cost_for_single_carnations} = $<<{cost_for_teachers}+{dozen_carnation_price}+{cost_for_single_carnations}={total_money_spent}>>{total_money_spent} on carnations
